results.title: Anima mundi
results.creator_credit: Godfrey Reggio, Lawrence Taub, World Wildlife Fund and Bvlgari
results.brief_description: This world is indeed a living being endowed with soul and intelligence. This quote from Plato’s “Timeus” guides the spirit of this ravishing short film. An original music score by Philip Glass, based on indigenous music from around the globe, is the soundtrack to a compilation of some of the world’s finest film footage of the animal kingdom. From mammals to reptiles, then to the mysterious worlds beneath the ocean, the film is a poetic celebration of the diversity and beauty of animal life. The music, integral to this film without dialogue, combines orchestral instruments with rhythms and sounds from across the globe. From the majesty of a lion’s face, to the intimate wonder of a cell multiplying, this is an excellent teacher of the rich legacy nature has left our planet. A co-production between Italy and the United States, “Anima Mundi” was partly funded by the World Wildlife Fund to celebrate their Biological Diversity Campaign.

results.title: Angus lost
results.creator_credit: Gary Templeton, John Sturner, Firehouse Productions and Evergreen Productions
results.brief_description: Angus is a very curious, clever Scottish terrier, whose curiosity gets him into a number of close scrapes. This is a live-action, non-verbal adaptation of Marjorie Flack’s classic book and is sure to delight audiences both young and old.

results.title: Angus
results.creator_credit: Andy Thomson, Michael Scott, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film portrait of Angus Mowat, with commentary by his son, author Farley Mowat. At 76, Angus still shows an enviable capacity for life, turning his hand to things that the leisure of retirement now makes possible. One of these is the rebuilding of an old fishing boat, converting it to sail. This is a picture of a man who has reached his later years with no slackening of interest in life, who finds a good and constant companion in nature, and contentment in the quiet isolation of his cabin by the shore.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andy Thomson, Michael Scott, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Angst
results.creator_credit: Judy Menczel, Bob Weis, Film Victoria, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Chapman and Lester Film Productions and Generation Films
results.brief_description: Deb Filler, Sandy Gutman aka Austen Tayshus, and Moshe Waldoks are three Australian comedians who all share one thing in common - they are all children of survivors of the Holocaust. This documentary takes us into the lives of these three Jewish comedians who talk about their lives, their family, their Jewish identity and the impact of the Holocaust in their humour, their performances and their relationships. Includes interviews, excerpts from each of their many live performances, archival footage and footage from the Inaugural Australasian Holocaust Descendants Gathering (1993?).

results.title: Angry Boy
results.creator_credit: Irving Jacoby, Alexander Hammid and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: An analysis of the emotional disturbance of a boy whose hostility finds expression in terms of stealing. Through the help of a child guidance clinic, this hostility is traced back to the source in the home life of the child where a good and well-intentioned mother has been taking out her hostility toward her mother and her husband in an over-protective attitude toward the child. The film then develops as it describes the process in which the child is helped by guidance personnel in his way to recovery. Cinematography by Peter Glushanok.

results.title: Angotee: story of an eskimo boy
results.creator_credit: Douglas Wilkinson, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The time is 1953 and the place is the eastern Arctic. Beginning with a scene in an igloo showing the birth of Angotee to Atootoo, wife of the hunter Koonuk, this film follows the events of a man’s growth from birth to maturity. During babyhood Angotee is secure in the protection of his mother. His childhood is free and happy as he plays games invented out of the skills he will need as a man. During adolescence he accompanies his father on the hunt and enters the company of men where he shoots his first seal. The story ends as Angotee leaves the parental igloo to set up his own abode as a family man and a hunter of the great snow-swept barrens. Awards: Durban; Trento; Toronto.

results.title: Anglo-Saxon England
results.brief_description: An outline of the history of Britain from the end of the Roman rule (A.D. 410) to the coming of the Normans (A.D. 1066), incorporating the results of recent archaeological research. Includes migrations from the Anglo-Saxon homelands, Saxon communities and craftsmanship, the early churches and Christianity, Viking attacks, King Alfred, the formation of England, revival of learning, Canute, Trelleborg and trade with the Continent.

results.title: Angles on an arc
results.brief_description: Gives proof of the theorem which states that the measure of the angle at the centre of a circle subtended by an arc is twice the measure of the angle at the circle subtended by the same arc.
results.description: Gives proof of the theorem which states that the measure of the angle at the centre of a circle subtended by an arc is twice the measure of the angle at the circle subtended by the same arc.
